intro: Sideroxylon orichalcium, commonly known as the goldenwood tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a thick, bark-like trunk and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its wood is dense and has a golden hue, making it valuable for ornamental and construction purposes. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
